meanings.definition: An animal of a major group of invertebrates, including the arthropods, mollusks, and annelids, in which the mouth develops before the anus during embryonic development.
meanings.sent1: The protostomes, like arthropods and mollusks, have mouths that form first in their early stages.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study protostomes to understand how their mouths develop before their anuses.
meanings.sent3: The protostomes had a race to see which one could develop its mouth first - it was quite a competition!
meanings.sent4: In the world of protostomes, being the first to have a mouth can mean the difference between survival and extinction.
meanings.sent5: The protostomes' unique feature of mouth-first development sets them apart from other invertebrates.

meanings.definition: The group of animals characterized by this developmental pattern.
meanings.sent1: Scientists classify animals into different groups, such as protostomes, based on their developmental patterns.
meanings.sent2: The protostomes, including arthropods and annelids, share a common feature in their development.
meanings.sent3: At the animal party, the protostomes were the talk of the town with their unique way of growing.
meanings.sent4: The protostomes stand out in the animal kingdom like stars in the night sky, each following the same developmental path.
meanings.sent5: Learning about protostomes helps us appreciate the diversity of life on Earth.
